page.title: 13Ledburn Farm
page.content: {Ledburn Farm, }in the village of the same name, consists of 470 acres of largely arable land, mostly put down to{oilseed rape, barley}and{wheat, } but with 20 acres of{sugar beet}grown for seed, and 10 acres of{evening {primrose,}a fairly new venture for the farmer. This crop is worth about Â£2000 a ton and the chemical industry is keen to buy it, but it must be cleaned to 97% purity after harvesting, which is not easy or cheap to achieve. Ledburn Farm also has 3,000{turkeys} which will be sold locally, fresh for Christmas, and 50{bullocks}which are sold to a butcher in Berkhamsted. The bullocks and turkeys are farmed intensively using cereals, but the cattle side of the business is gradually being reduced as it is difficult to produce the quality of beef required.
